choices.A: The expense report status remains Pending Payables Approval.
choices.C: The employee must reply to the notification before the reimbursement process can continue.
choices.B: The expense report is routed back to the approvers.
choices.D: The employee must resubmit the expense report.

discussion.content:
Believe the answer is A&B as Oracle Doc specifically states that Employee does not need to resubmit and that response to the Request More Info is optional. Since status remains Pending Payables Approval then it would be routed back for Approval, hence, A&B are correct.
From https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/financials/20d/fawde/expense-report-audit.html#FAWDE656029

Request More Information
To request more information for an expense report, select the Request More Information option from the Actions menu in the header of the Audit Expense Report page. The employee receives a notification that includes the reason for the request, specific instructions, and any additional instructions from you. Selecting the Request More Information action results in the following:

The employee doesn't need to resubmit the returned expense report. He can optionally reply to the notification.

The expense report status remains Pending Payables Approval.

You can complete the audit before the requested information is received from the employee.

A. The expense report status remains Pending Payables Approval.
D. The employee must resubmit the expense report.

questions.question_text: The expense auditor has chosen to Request More Information for an expense report. Select two ways the system processes this action.
What is the difference between subject areas that append the word "Real Time" and those that do not?

discussion.content:
In Oracle Fusion applications, there are two types of subject areas:

Subject areas whose names usually end with Real Time and access real-time (transactional) data

Subject areas whose names usually do not end with Real Time and access data warehouse data.

B. The "Real Time" subject areas are based on real-time transactions in the applications, and those that are not, are based on data stored in the Oracle Business Intelligence Applications data warehouse.

choices.D: The "Real Time" subject areas are based on subledger transactions and the ones that are not are based on general ledger balances.
choices.B: The "Real Time" subject areas are based on real-time transactions in the applications, and those that are not, are based on data stored in the Oracle Business Intelligence Applications data warehouse.
choices.A: The "Real Time" subject areas are based on real-time transactions and those that are not, are based on historical data.

questions.question_text:
An invoice for $1,000 USD and a credit memo for ($1,100) USD are due for payment. What are the two outcomes if you chose the "Apply Credits Up to Zero
Amount" option when submitting a Payment Process Request?

choices.D: Only the invoice is paid fully but the credit memo is partially paid with a credit of ($100) USD remaining.
choices.C: Both the invoice and the credit memo are fully paid.
choices.A: Both the invoice and the credit memo are included in the Payment Process Request.
choices.B: Neither the invoice nor the credit memo is included in the Payment Process Request.

choices.D: Any realized gain or loss previously calculated is reversed.
choices.A: All related interest invoices are reversed if previously created.
choices.B: Any previous accounting and payment records for an invoice are reversed.
choices.E: Voiding the payment automatically places an invoice on hold.
choices.C: All related withholding tax invoices are automatically voided.

discussion.content:
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/A60725_05/html/comnls/us/ap/adjpmt05.htm#t_pmt_void

When you void a payment, Payables automatically reverses the accounting and payment records so your general ledger will have the correct information,

Option C is not correct. The system doesn't void the withholding invoice, it creates a reversing invoice. Big difference.
Per Oracle Using Payables Invoice to Pay: What happens if I void a payment? "If the invoice is associated with a withholding tax invoice and tax is withheld at payment, a reversing invoice is automatically created."

Answer is A,B,D 
cause C says invoices voided which is not applicable for invoices. You can not void invoice.
C. All related withholding tax invoices are automatically voided.

comments.content: You can generate Withholding tax invoice at Payment as well, there is a choice of whether you want to generate the W/O invoice at Invoice level or at Payment level, please check the "Manage Tax Reporting and Withholding Tax Options" & the Tax Invoice creation point.
withholdin tax 'invoice' is generated at invoice not at payment. C is not correct. Answer is : ABD like jo123 said

discussion.content: It is crime to even think that B could be right. ACD is correct answer

questions.question_text: The Accounts Payable Manager voided a foreign currency payment due to insufficient funds. Which three statements are correct?

discussion.content: B. You must provide a start date, an end date, and the accrual account for the prepaid expenses in the invoice lines or distributions.

questions.question_text:
You have an invoice for a three-month lease and wish to recognize the expense monthly for the duration of the lease.
What must be entered on the invoice in order to do this?

choices.B: You must provide a start date, an end date, and the accrual account for the prepaid expenses in the invoice lines or distributions.
choices.D: You must provide the accrual account for the prepaid expenses in the invoice lines or distributions.
choices.C: You must provide a start date and the accrual account for the prepaid expenses in the ivoice lines or distributions.
choices.A: You must provide a start date and an end date for the prepaid expenses in the invoice lines or distributions.
